name: Purety in ugly time
reviewBody:
For me, "I am David" was not a good/beautiful film but an interesting experience.

A piece of Proust's madeleine, way in a lost time, rediscovering of images, a catharsis form.

The story of David is the Edmondo de Amicis Cuore's experience. Same message, same innocence and trip.

The story of David is picture of a brutal time. I saw looking this film, not only for the location of action, moments of blessed father Vincent Eugene Bossilkoff, a Bulgarian member of Congregation of the Passion, martyred on November 11, 1952 by Communist regime. I saw the shadow of a hated era and forms of resistance against the evil.

Maybe, this film is a masterpiece. Or a boring show about strange gestures and facts. For "free world", the crimes of East Europe are, in fact, only form of fiction. In essence, in the deep of souls of many people, the Communism is not ghost, traumatic event or sadistic game. Like butchers or victims, it is a eternal illness. Dust in blood's composition, memories of weak power and fear.

So, Ben Tibber's character is not a boy with a great mission but the face of purity in an ugly time.
